page.title: 09HUMPHREY HOLDINGS (1)
page.content: {HUMPHREY HOLDINGS}is a poultry farm.It occupies a 5 acre site at Steep Marsh and is part of HH Ltd,Winchester.The site was formerly owned by Mr D.Ryder. He used it mainly for poultry farming also.Ryder now owns "Farmfax" next door.Humphrey Holdings sells some of the eggs it produces in its shop, and some locally, but the vast bulk of production (35,000 eggs, three times a week) goes to Thames Valley Eggs,at Headcorn,Kent.There are 45,000 pullets at the farm,(from day old chics to 18 weeks), and over 60,000 laying birds. The laying period for a hen is from the 18th to 76th week. There are three main sheds,each 200' by 50'.Each contains about 18,000 birds.Hens live four to a cage. There is very little room to move inside. They're fed 8 times a day by conveyor belt,and water is always available.(Cont - next page)
